sentences.text: LETTER FROM THE CHAIRMAN AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 7, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recently completed our second year as a fully independent, publicly traded company and I am pleased to invite you to attend our annual meeting of stockholders to be held on Thursday, April 27, 2017, at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time, at our headquarters located at One Citizens Plaza, Providence, Rhode Island 02903.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Youll find the matters scheduled for consideration at the meeting described in detail in the following 2017 Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you owned shares of our stock as of March 3, 2017, we encourage you to vote on these matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to accommodate those attending, we ask that you please mark your enclosed proxy card to let us know of your plans to attend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registration and seating will begin at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time and we will ask you to sign an admittance card and present valid picture identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you held your shares in a brokerage account please be sure to bring a copy of a brokerage statement that shows you held shares as of March 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cameras and recording devices will not be permitted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We furnish our proxy materials to stockholders on the internet at www.edocumentview.com/CFG in order to provide you with the information you need in an expedited manner while significantly lowering the costs of delivery and reducing the environmental impact of our annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will receive a notice with instructions for accessing the proxy materials and voting via the Internet in addition to information about how to obtain paper copies of our proxy materials if you would prefer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important and whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, we encourage you to access electronic voting via the Internet or utilize the automated telephone voting feature as described on your enclosed proxy card, or you may sign, date and return the proxy card in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote in person if you plan to attend the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of our board of directors, we thank you for your support of Citizens Financial Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bruce Van Saun Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS TO BE HELD ON APRIL 27, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Stockholders of Citizens Financial Group, Inc.:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the annual meeting of stockholders (the Annual Meeting) of Citizens Financial Group nc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: , a Delaware corporation (the Company), will be held on April 27, 2017, at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time, at the Companys headquarters located at One Citizens Plaza, Providence, Rhode Island 02903 for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of the twelve directors named in the accompanying proxy statement to serve until the 2018 annua meeting or until their successors are duly elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Advisory vote to approve the Companys executive compensation, commonly referred to as a say on pay vote;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Ratification of the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. The transaction of such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting or any reconvened meeting following any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record at the close of business on March 3, 2017 are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are first sending this proxy statement and the enclosed proxy form to stockholders on or about March 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors recommends that you vote FOR the election of each of the director nominees named in Proposal No. 1 of the proxy statement, FOR, on an advisory basis, the Companys executive compensation as described in Proposal No. 2 of the proxy statement, and FOR the ratification of the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm as described in Proposal No. 3 of the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our Annual Meeting, we have elected to use the Internet as the primary means of providing our proxy materials to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will send to these stockholders of record a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) with instructions for accessing the proxy materials, including our proxy statement and annual report, and for voting via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice provides the information above and also provides information on how stockholders may obtain paper copies of our proxy materials free of charge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electronic delivery of our proxy materials significantly reduces our printing and mailing costs and the environmental impact of circulating our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also provides information on how to vote, including how to attend the meeting and vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: i
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting, but whether or not you expect to attend in person, you are urged to mark, date and sign your proxy card and return it by mail or follow the alternative voting procedures described in the Notice or the proxy card.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record may vote by using the Internet or (if you received a proxy card by mail) by mail as described below.

sentences.text: Stockholders also may attend the meeting and vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Charter and Bylaws provide that the Board shall consist of not less than 5 nor more than 25 directors, excluding any directors elected by holders of preferred stock pursuant to provisions applicable only in the case of defaults under the terms of our preferred stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exact number of directors will be fixed from time to time by resolution of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has fixed the current number of directors at twelve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of office of all directors expire at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each annual meeting, the successors of the directors are elected to hold office for a term expiring at the next annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors is therefore asking you to elect the nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All twelve have been nominated for reelection at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Corporate Governance Proposal 1Election of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws were amended on October 20, 2016 to provide for the election of directors by a majority of the votes cast in an uncontested election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the twelve individuals nominated for election to the Board must receive more FOR than AGAINST votes (among votes properly cast in person, electronically or by proxy) to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are not considered votes cast for the foregoing purpose, and will have no effect on the election of nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for a greater number of persons than the number of nominees named.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and return the accompanying proxy card, your shares will be voted for the election of the twelve nominees recommended by the Board unless you choose to vote against any of the nominees or abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee for any reason is unable to serve or will not serve, proxies may be voted for such substitute nominee as the proxy holder may determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not aware of any nominee who will be unable to or will not serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the election of directors is not an uncontested election, directors are elected by a plurality of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws also provide that directors may be removed, with or without cause, by an affirmative vote of shares representing a majority of the outstanding shares then entitled to vote at an election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any vacancy occurring on our Board and any newly created directorship may be filled only by a vote of a majority of the remaining directors in office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When considering whether directors and director nominees have the experience, qualifications, attributes or skills, taken as a whole, to enable our Board to satisfy its oversight responsibilities effectively in light of our business and structure, our Board focuses primarily on each persons background and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our directors provide an appropriate mix of experience and skills relevant to the size and nature of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bruce Van Saun
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age: 59 Director Since: 2013 Committees: Executive (Chair); Equity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Experience and Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experienced executive in the financial services industry, extensive financial background and service on the boards of other public companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional role as our Chief Executive Officer brings managements perspective to Board deliberations and provides valuable information about the status of day-to-day operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining the Company as Chairman and CEO, Mr. Van Saun served as The Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc Finance Director and was a member of its board of directors from October 2009 to October 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1997 to 2008, Mr. Van Saun held a number of senior positions with The Bank of New York and later The Bank of New York Mellon, including Vice Chairman and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earlier in his career, he held senior positions with Deutsche Bank, Wasserstein Perella Group and Kidder Peabody & Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all, Mr. Van Saun has more than 30 years of financial services experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Van Saun has also served on the boards of directors of our subsidiaries Citizens Bank, N.A. (CBNA) and Citizens Bank of Pennsylvania (CBPA) since October 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Van Saun joined the board of directors of Moodys Corporation on March 1, 2016 and serves on the Audit and Governance and Compensation Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also sits on the Federal Advisory Council and is a member of The Clearing House supervisory board, and serves on the boards of Jobs for Massachusetts, the Partnership for Rhode Island, and the National Constitution Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previous directorships held by Mr. Van Saun in both the United Kingdom and United States include Lloyds of London (from September 2012 to May 2016), Direct Line Insurance Group plc (from April 2012 to October 2013), WorldPay (Ship Midco Limited) (from July 2011 to September 2013) and ConvergEx Inc. (from May 2007 to October 2013).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Van Saun received a B.S. in Business Administration from Bucknell University in 1979 and an M.B.A. in Finance and General Management from the University of North Carolina in 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark Casady
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age: 56 Director Since: 2014 Committees: Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Experience and Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance and risk experience as an executive in the financial services industry and service on the board of governors of Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) and the board of the Financial Services Roundtable   Expertise in the area of wealth management and brokerage including as Chief Executive Officer of LPL Financial Holdings, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Knowledge of technology and innovation through his service on the board of Eze Software Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Knowledge of technology and innovation through his service on the board of Eze Software Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Casady is the former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of LPL Financial Holdings Inc (LPL Financial).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: from which he retired in March 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He joined LPL Financial in May 2002 as Chief Operating Officer, became President in April 2003 and Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in December 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining LPL Financial, he was Managing Director, mutual fund group for Deutsche Asset Management, Americasformerly Scudder Investments.

sentences.text: BOARD GOVERNANCE AND OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following sections provide an overview of our board governance structure and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other topics, we describe how we select directors, how we consider the independence of our directors and key aspects of our Board operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selecting Nominees for Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has delegated to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee the responsibility of reviewing and recommending to the Board nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee evaluates and recommends candidates for Board membership to the Board annually and as vacancies or newly created positions occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, a slate of directors is nominated by the Board and submitted to a stockholder vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will consider for nomination persons who have demonstrated eadership, have experience or relevant knowledge, time availability and commitment, the highest character, reputation and integrity, the analytical and critical thinking skills, the financial literacy, risk management and other business experience and acumen, the ability to work as a team constructively in a collegial environment and who exhibited ndependent thought and judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also recommends individuals for membership on the committees of the Board annually and as vacancies or newly created positions occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its recommendations for Board and committee membership, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews candidates qualifications for membership on the Board or committee (including making a specific determination as to the independence of the candidate) based on the criteria described above and taking into account the enhanced independence, financial literacy and financial and risk management expertise standards that may be required under law, regulation or New York Stock Exchange rules for committee membership purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee evaluates current directors for re-nomination to the Board or committee, including assessing such directors performance and reassessing their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also periodically reviews the composition of the Board and its committees in light of the current challenges and needs of the Board and the Company, and determines whether it may be appropriate to add or remove individuals after considering issues of judgment, diversity, age, skills, background and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key elements of our Board composition are highlighted below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New candidates may be identified through recommendations from independent directors or members of management, search firms, discussions with other persons who may know of suitable candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to serve on the board of directors, and stockholder recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluations of prospective candidates typically include a review of the candidates background and qualifications by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, interviews with the committee as a whole, one or more members of the committee, or one or more other board members, and discussions within the committee and the full board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will consider director candidates proposed by stockholders as well as recommendations from other sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder who wishes to recommend a prospective candidate for the board of directors for consideration by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may do so by submitting the name and qualifications of the prospective candidate in writing to the following address: Corporate Secretary, 600 Washington Boulevard, Stamford, Connecticut 06901.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders must propose nominees for consideration by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee in accordance with the procedures and other requirements set forth in our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Information for Stockholders2018 Annual Meeting and Stockholder Proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of its listing standards, the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) has adopted certain criteria that our Board considers when determining director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the NYSE rules, the Board also broadly considers all other relevant facts and circumstances that bear on the materiality of each directors relationship with the Company, including the potential for conflicts of interest, when determining director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board considers whether the Company or one of its subsidiaries has a lending relationship, deposit relationship, or other banking or commercial relationship with a director, an immediate family member, or an entity with which the director or a family member is affiliated by reason of being a director, an officer or a significant stockholder thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such relationship must meet the following criteria:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) it must be in the ordinary course of business and on substantially the same terms as those prevailing at the time for comparable transactions with non-affiliated persons; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) with respect to extensions of credit by the Company or its subsidiaries to such entity: (a) such extensions of credit have been made in compliance with applicable law, including Federal Reserve Regulation O and Section 13(k) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act) and (b) no event of default has occurred and is continuing beyond any period of cure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Board in its determination of director independence, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee annually evaluates each prospective and incumbent director using the foregoing standards and such other factors as the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee deems appropriate, and makes a recommendation to the Board regarding the independence or non- independence of each such person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of this evaluation process, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee considers all relevant facts and circumstances and, in particular, the independence requirements of the Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Banking relationships with the Company or any of its subsidiaries (including deposit, investment, lending, fiduciary) that are conducted in the ordinary course of business on substantially the same terms and conditions as are otherwise available to nonaffiliated customers for comparable transactions are not considered material in determining independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have determined that each of Mr. Casady, Ms. Cumming, Mr. Di lorio, Mr. Hankowsky, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Higdon, Mr. Koch, Mr. Ryan, Mr. Subramaniam, Ms. Watson and Ms. Zuraitis is an independent director within the meaning of the applicable rules of the SEC and NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of Mr. Di lorio, Mr. Hankowsky, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Higdon, Mr. Koch and Ms. Watson is also an independent director under Rule 10A-3 of the Exchange Act for the purpose of audit committee membership, and each of Mr. Ryan, Mr. Hankowsky, Mr. Higdon and Ms. Watson is also an independent director under Rule 10C-1 of the Exchange Act for the purpose of Compensation and Human Resources Committee

sentences.text: Executive Sessions of Our Non-Management Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys non-employee directors participate in regularly scheduled executive sessions in which management does not participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the non-employee directors include directors who are not considered independent, the independent directors must also meet in executive session at least once a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director (or Chairman, if the Chairman is a non-employee director) shall preside at each executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, our Lead Director is Arthur F. Ryan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interested persons may make their concerns known directly to the Lead Director or the non-management directors as a group by submitting their written correspondence to the Companys Corporate Secretary located at 600 Washington Boulevard, Stamford, Connecticut 06901.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary may facilitate such direct communication to the Lead Director or the non-management directors as a group by reviewing, sorting and summarizing such communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that our Chief Executive Officer shall serve as Chairman of the Board, while an independent director shall serve as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the significant duties designated to our independent Lead Director, the Boards view is that having a combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer enables it to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) provide efficient and effective governance and leadership to the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) be apprised of current risks and issues that may impact the Company in a timely manner, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) present a single point of leadership to all Company stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board has determined that a combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer position, with an independent Lead Director, is the most appropriate Board leadership structure for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews its leadership structure periodically in light of the composition of the Board, the needs of the Company and its stockholders, the practices of the Companys peers, and other factors, and retains its flexibility to allocate the responsibilities of the offices of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in any way that is in the best interests of the Company at a given point in time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director is an independent director designated by the Board, based on the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to other duties and responsibilities of the Lead Director set forth in the Corporate Governance Guidelines or our Bylaws, the Lead Director shall:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preside at Board and stockholder meetings at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serve as a liaison between the independent directors and the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review and approve, in coordination with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, agendas/agenda planners for Board meetings, materials, information and meeting schedules, and have the authority to add items to the agenda for any Board meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have the authority to call meetings of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be available for consultation and direct communication with major stockholders and regulators upon request;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discuss with the Chief Executive Officer, together with the Chair of the Compensation Committee, the results of the Boards annual evaluation of the Chief Executive Officers performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: perform such other functions as the Board shall direct or request from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Mr. Van Saun serves as our Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer and Mr. Ryan serves as our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for oversight of the Companys internal controls and risk management framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight generally requires evaluation of managements systems of internal control, financial reporting and public disclosure, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of financial results and review and approval of the Companys enterprise risk management framework and ensuring that risks to the Company are properly managed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has delegated its risk oversight duties to the Risk Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board receives independent reports from each of the Audit Committee and the Risk Committee at each of its meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Risk Committee is responsible for overseeing the design, implementation and operation of the Companys enterprise-wide risk management, including with respect to funding and liquidity risk, credit risk, market risk, strategic risk, business risk, reputation risk, operational risk, model risk and pension risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Committee reviews and, as it deems appropriate, recommends to the Board the design and implementation of the Companys risk strategy and policy, risk appetite framework and specific risk appetites and limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Committee serves as the primary point of contact between the Board and the management-level committees that deal with risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Committees responsibility is one of oversight, and the Committee has no duty to ensure compliance with laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Corporate GovernanceBoard Governance and Oversight Committees of the BoardRisk Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines, Committee Charters and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines, which set forth a flexible framework within which our Board, assisted by Board committees, directs our affairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines address, among other things, the composition and functions of the Board, director independence, Board and Board committee evaluations, compensation of directors, management succession and review, Board committees and selection of new directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines are available on the corporate governance section of our investor relations website at www.citizensbank.com/investor-relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charters for each of the Audit, Compensation, Nominating and Corporate Governance, Risk and Executive Committees are also available on the corporate governance section of our investor relations website at www.citizensbank.com/investor-relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has also adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the Code), which sets forth key guiding principles concerning ethical conduct and is applicable to all of our directors, officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code addresses, among other things, conflicts of interest, protection of confidential information and compliance with laws, rules and regulations, and describes the process by which any concerns about violations should be reported.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code is available on the corporate governance section of our investor relations website at www.citizensbank.com/investor-relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also obtain a copy, free of charge, by writing to our Corporate Secretary at 600 Washington Boulevard, Stamford, Connecticut 06901.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amendments to the Code, or any waivers of its requirements, will be disclosed on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATED PERSON TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and Procedures for Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a written related person transactions policy pursuant to which our executive officers, directors and significant stockholders, including their immediate family members, are not permitted to enter into a related person transaction with us without the consent of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to certain transactions excluded from the policy, any request for us to enter into a transaction with an executive officer, director, significant stockholder or any of such persons immediate family members, in which the amount involved exceeds $120,000, is required to be presented to our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee for review, consideration and approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors, director nominees, executive officers and significant stockholders are required to report to our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee any such related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving or rejecting the proposed transaction, our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will take into account, among other factors it deems appropriate, the commercial reasonableness of the terms, the benefit or perceived benefit, or lack thereof, to the Company, opportunity costs of alternate transactions, the materiality and character of the related persons direct or indirect interest and the actual or perceived conflict of interest of the related person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with Executive Officers and Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide credit facilities from time to time to certain directors and executive officers and their immediate families, as well as their affiliated companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These credit facilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) complied with our Regulation O policies and procedures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) were made in the ordinary course of business,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) were made on substantially the same terms, including interest rates and collateral, as those prevailing at the time for comparable loans with persons not related to the lender, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) did not involve more than a normal risk of collectability or did not present other features unfavorable to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications may be addressed to the Lead Director or any alternate director, marked as confidential or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to other correspondence received by the Company that is addressed to one or more directors, the Board has requested that the following items not be distributed to directors, because they generally fall into the purview of management, rather than the Board: junk mail and mass mailings, product and services complaints, product and services inquiries, resumes and other forms of job inquiries, solicitations for charitable donations, surveys, business solicitations and advertisements.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2 - ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, enacted in July 2010, requires that we provide our stockholders with the opportunity to vote to approve, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement in accordance with the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, we seek to closely align the interests of our named executive officers with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to review the complete description of our executive compensation programs provided in this proxy statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the compensation tables and accompanying narrative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we ask our stockholders to vote on the following resolution at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys stockholders approve, on a nonbinding, advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys executive officers named in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K (which disclosure includes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and accompanying narrative).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote on this proposal is advisory and, therefore, is not binding, the Compensation Committee will carefully consider the stockholder vote on this matter, including whether any actions will be necessary to address the concerns, if any, of our stockholders.

sentences.text: Significant 2016 Executive Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 98% of the votes cast on the annual advisory say on pay vote conducted at our 2016 annual meeting approved the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this favorable result, no specific actions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: were taken in response to the vote, although we have made the following decisions during 2016 which we believe serve to further align the Companys executive compensation program with the interests of our stockholders, consistent with good governance and market practice:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discontinued our use of role-based allowances effective January 1, 2016, which significantly reduced the level of fixed pay for our executives, further aligning our compensation program with US market practice;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We executed an amended employment agreement with our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Bruce Van Saun, which balances the Companys obligations to Mr. Van Saun under his prior agreement and achieves the following positive results for the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) motivates and rewards Mr. Van Saun for the achievement of our strategic objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) provides additional retentive value; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) aligns terms and conditions more closely with US market practice;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We approved an executive pay mix for 2016 aligned to regulatory and investor expectations, which delivers 50%-70% of variable compensation in the form of long-term awards (70% for our CEO) and 20%-50% of variable compensation in the form of performance stock units that are earned based on achievement of financial results (50% for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We granted performance stock units in March 2016 that vest after a three-year performance period, depending on the level of achievement against average return on average tangible common equity and cumulative diluted earnings per share measures during the period of January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2018, in order to further enhance the alignment between the interests of our executives and stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expanded the number of employees receiving a portion of their variable compensation in the form of performance stock units, starting with grants made in March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy & Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he fundamental principles that guide the design and implementation of compensation programs for our NEOs include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract, retain, motivate and reward high-caliber executives to deliver long-term business performance within acceptable risk parameters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide clear alignment between annual and long-term compensation for executives and the Companys strategi plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Support a culture where employees recognize the importance of serving customers well and are rewarded for superior performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Encourage the creation of value over the long-term and align the rewards of executives with returns to stockholders.

sentences.text: Highlights of our Pay Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our pay practices demonstrate our commitment to alignment with stockholders interests and our dedication to maintaining a compensation program supported by strong corporate governance, as exemplified by the following practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historic Ownership Structure and Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to our public offering in September 2014, the Company was a wholly-owned subsidiary of The Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc (RBS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that time, our executive compensation was governed by the philosophy and objectives of RBS and was subject to approval by the RBS Performance and Remuneration Committee of the Board of Directors (RemCo).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decision-making authority for executive compensation transitioned to our Compensation Committee upon our initial public offering, with RemCos role limited to ensuring compliance with UK and European regulations until RBS completed the sale of its equity interest in the Company in November 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until that time, our NEOs remained subject to UK Remuneration Code requirements regarding variable pay as well as the requirements of Capital Requirements Directive IV (CRD IV), which mandated that they could not receive variable compensation in excess of 100% of fixed compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to deliver competitive levels of compensation to our employees impacted by CRD IV, role-based allowances were implemented by RBS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following RBS sale of its remaining equity interest in the Company in November 2015, UK and European remuneration regulations no longer applied to the Company and we have made several changes to our compensation program consistent with our philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most notably, we have eliminated role-based allowances in order to more effectively align our compensation program with our strategic objectives, the interests of our stockholders and practices at our US peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts of the former role-based allowances have become part of executives variable compensation opportunities for 2016 and future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although UK and European regulations no longer apply to us at the current time, much of the compensation disclosed in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table for 2015 and 2014 was partially driven by compliance with the regulatory environment in which we were operating at the time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the principal elements of the compensation program that applied to our NEOs for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element is described more fully in subsequent sections of the CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Fawcett, our Interim Chief Financial Officer, was eligible for base salary only.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable compensation is designed to reward achievement of long- term objectives and annual progress toward those objectives, in a manner that aligns pay with the interests of stockholders and is market competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our variable compensation is designed to discourage inappropriate risk taking by delivering a balanced portfolio of compensation distributed among fixed and variable pay, short- and long-term incentives, and cash and equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable compensation awards for NEOs are determined based on Company, divisional/functional and individual performance, as discussed below in Executive Compensation Decisions, and include long-term awards and short-term awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element of Pay    Objective    Key Characteristics    Long-Term Awards    Generally granted in the form of restricted stock units and performance stock units, long-term awards are intended to tie executive pay to the interests of stockholders and to provide retention incentives for executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value actually realized by the executive varies based on stock price movement and other financial performance factors in the case of performance stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 performance year, 60%-70% of variable compensation was delivered to the NEOs in the form of long-term awards, of which between 50%-70% was in the form of performance stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Awards    The remaining portion of variable pay for the 2016 performance year was delivered in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other  Benefits    To give executives an opportunity to provide for their retirement and address other specific needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to participate in our Company-sponsored benefit programs, including our broad-based 401(k) plan and employee stock purchase plan, on the same terms and conditions that apply to all of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provide certain perquisites to our NEOs, which are described in footnote 8 to the 2016 Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is composed of independent directors and is responsible for establishing, implementing and monitoring the administration of our executive compensation plans and programs and for approving our executives compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among its duties, the Compensation Committee is responsible for determining the compensation of our CEO, and based upon recommendations from the CEO (together with our Chief Human Resources Officer), approving compensation for our other executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee is generally responsible for overseeing our material compensation and benefit plans, recommending to the Board of Directors non-employee director compensation, evaluating executive performance, and reviewing talent management and succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Advisory Partners, LLC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retained Compensation Advisory Partners, LLC (CAP) to provide guidance and advice on compensation-related matters during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CAP was directly selected and retained by the Compensation Committee to provide a broad set of services pertaining to the compensation of our executives and our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not engage CAP for any additional services outside of executive and director compensation consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with CAPs retention and on an annual basis, the Compensation Committee conducts an assessment of potential conflicts of interest of CAP, considering various factors including but not limited to the six factors mandated by the New York Stock Exchange rules, and no conflicts of interest relating to its services have been identified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: McLagan, AON Hewitt (MaLagan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management retains McLagan to provide market compensation data, which is referenced by the Compensation Committee when making executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to our internal review of incentive plans, in 2015 management engaged McLagan to conduct an external review of our incentive compensation plans in order to assess them from a risk perspective and to make design recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We plan to continue to engage an external consultant to conduct this type of analysis at least once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO reviews the performance of each of the other NEOs annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this review, the CEO (together with our Chief Human Resources Officer) makes salary and variable compensation recommendations for NEOs (other than himself) to the Compensation Committee for review, feedback, and approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO does not have any role in determining his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its decision-making process, the Compensation Committee uses a peer group of companies for comparisons of compensation and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee discusses the construct of the peer group on an annual basis, and makes any necessary adjustments based on the advice of management and its independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During its annual review of the peer group, the Compensation Committee considers the size, complexity, and business mix of potential peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Compensation Committee refers to competitive compensation and performance information in making compensation decisions, it does not target a specific percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined in 2016 that continued use of the following peer group, which is consistent with our financial peer group, remained appropriate for its reference in making 2016 performance year decisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BB&T Corporation   KeyCorp   SunTrust Banks, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica Corporation   M&T Bank Corporation   Regions Financial Corporation Fifth Third Bancorp   The PNC Financial Services Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs salaries are reviewed by the Compensation Committee annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs salaries are subject to change at the Compensation Committees discretion if, among other reasons, the executives responsibilities change materially or there are significant changes in the competitive market environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No modifications have been made to our NEOs salaries or 2016 or 2017, as the Compensation Committee determined each of their salaries is at a level appropriate to their role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the amounts of our NEOs base salaries earned during 2016, see the Salary column of the 2016 Summary Compensation Table below, along with accompanying footnotes.

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining Variable Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines the variable compensation amounts for our NEOs on a discretionary basis, based on an evaluation of Company and individual performance (within, and subject to, the parameters of our annual ncentive plan described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors considered by the Compensation Committee represent both objective and subjective considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not necessarily favor one measure over another or apply a particular formula or weighting, but instead uses a balanced view of performance to gain a comprehensive understanding of the Companys overall results and the individual executives results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making these determinations, the Compensation Committee evaluates a broad set of performance criteria through the use of a scorecard reflecting the following dimensions: financial and business delivery; risk and control; customer; strategic initiatives; and people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The elements considered reflect a balanced review of performance, providing a means for applying structured discretion in assessing results and determining pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior leaders, including our NEOs, are also subject to an annual risk assessment by our Chief Risk Officer, the results of which are considered by the Compensation Committee when making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, executive compensation levels at our peer firms are considered by the Compensation Committee based on most recently available data (2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer firms for this purpose are identified above in Executive Compensation GovernanceCompensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Mr. Van Saun, in determining his variable compensation amount, consideration is also given to his target total compensation amount of $7.5 million established by his amended employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the 2016 variable compensation amounts reflected below in the 2016 Performance Year Compensation Supplemental Table for our NEOs were appropriate, in large part, due to 2016 Company performance described earlier in Performance Highlights and the following key individual achievements during 2016:

sentences.text: Launched several initiatives focused on customer experience and satisfaction, which remains a key focus.

sentences.text: Continued to deepen relationships through robust engagement with stockholders, analysts and clients
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved further progress toward building a strong culture focused on continued improvement in compliance and risk management, enhanced our risk appetite framework and received a non-objection to our CCAR submission for the second year in a row.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to build on our previous success of attracting and retaining high-performing talent for various key positions on our senior leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased focus on leadership development and gained momentum in colleague culture and engagement as well as community engagement, including the development of a new corporate campus in Johnston, Rhode Island.

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Strong financial performance driven by growth in our lead relationships, client penetration and revenue diversification across client and product groups.

sentences.text: Launched the Commercial broker-dealer as well as the implementation of new interest rate and market risk platforms for Global Markets, thereby improving the revenue generation process and creating efficiencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed various customer experience initiatives focused on process and technology improvements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed a build-out of Capital and Global Markets, continued to strengthen Treasury Solutions platform, and created a new strategy for the Asset Finance business.

sentences.text: Drove a transformation of the distribution network through a focus on transaction migration, implementation of the branch of the future, and providing training to branch colleagues in order for them to more effectively address customer needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued strong trajectory of performance in our Consumer Lending businesses, with our student loan refinance and Apple iUP products and the introduction of a new unsecured loan product.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued focus on customer experience initiatives, resulting in improvement in customer experience against key metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased deposits at a rate exceeding peer growth and expanded capabilities in key fee income businesses.

sentences.text: Completed a Consumer risk transformation aligned to our credo, policies and frameworks and regulatory expectations.

sentences.text: Developed processes to enhance and create efficiencies in connection with vendor transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half of each 2016 PSU Award is earned based on cumulative diluted earnings per share (Diluted EPS) and half is earned based on average return on average tangible common equity (ROTCE), with a maximum payout of 150% of target.

sentences.text: 2015 PSU Award Performance Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assessed performance levels for performance stock units granted in 2015 relating to the 2014 performance year (the 2015 PSU Awards) at its meeting held on February 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2015 PSU Awards have a performance period of January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2016 and are based half on Diluted EPS and half on ROTCE, with a maximum award of 125% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that, under the plan, Diluted EPS of $1.97 was achieved (resulting in a 36.5% payout) and ROTCE of 8.05% was achieved (resulting in a 37.5% payout), resulting in an overall payout of 74% for the 2015 PSU Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Reported Return on Tangible Common Equity of 7.74% was adjusted to remove the impact of the change in Other Comprehensive Income (OCI), both in the target and in the impact of the actual change in OCI over the performance period, resulting in a 31 basis point adjustment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In spite of strong execution of the Companys plan, the level of interest rates remained lower than anticipated when the targets were set, resulting in the lower than target payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Compensation Committee determines there was such nadequate sensitivity to risk it may, in its discretion, reduce the amount of awards to be paid out at vest up to 100%, in the aggregate for all grantees or on an individual basis.

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committees objective was to put into place an arrangement that balanced its former obligations under Mr. Van Sauns prior agreement and achieved the following positive results for the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) motivates and rewards Mr. Van Saun for the achievement of our strategic objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) provides additional retentive value; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) aligns terms and conditions more closely with US market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elimination of role-based allowance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elimination of Mr. Van Sauns annual role-based allowance of $2.7 million, which was previously required in order to ensure compliance with the bonus cap required by CRD IV, thereby allowing a larger portion of his compensation for 2016 and future years to be in the form of variable compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elimination of pension benefit funding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual pension benefit funding of approximately $562,000 was provided to Mr. Van Saun under the former agreement, as originally agreed by RBS and intended to make him whole for pension benefit funding received during his service to RBS in the UK.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension benefit funding has been eliminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant of a special one-time equity award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grant of a one-time equity award with a target value of $3 million has been made to Mr. Van Saun, half of which was granted in the form of restricted stock units and half in performance stock units (in the case of performance stock units, with vesting level depending on performance, as described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award will become vested on the three year anniversary of the grant date, provided Mr. Van Saun does not resign prior to that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance stock units are intended to focus and reward Mr. Van Saun for successful achievement of the Companys long-term strategic plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the Compensation Committee will conduct an assessment of results across financial, risk, customer and enterprise initiative performance dimensions following the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that making this one-time award to Mr. Van Saun would provide additional retentive value, in addition to providing him with consideration for the elimination of his pension benefit funding in a form that further aligns Mr. Van Saun with the strategic objectives of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elimination of paid notice period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new agreement eliminates a six month paid notice period for Mr. Van Saun in a voluntary resignation scenario.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Institution of a fixed term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The former agreement continued indefinitely, whereas the new agreement has an initial five-year term that will be extended automatically for a subsequent two-year term unless either party provides at least 12 months notice to terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of Mr. Van Sauns amended employment agreement are described in greater detail below under the heading Termination of Employment and Change of ControlEmployment Agreements with our NEOsEmployment Agreement with Mr. Van Saun.

sentences.text: Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sponsor two nonqualified deferred compensation plansthe CFG Deferred Compensation Plan and the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following closure of the CFG Deferred Compensation Plan to new participants on December 31, 2008, the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan was adopted, effective as of January 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred compensation plans currently do not offer any matching contributions or provide for above-market earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Mr. Van Saun participated in the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the material terms of this deferred compensation plan, see the narrative following the 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sponsor the CFG Pension Plan, a tax-qualified, non-contributory defined benefit pension plan that was closed to new participants effective January 1, 2009 and frozen to all participants and benefit accruals effective December 31, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Conner had a benefit under this plan as of December 31, 2016 because he was hired prior to 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the material terms of the CFG Pension Plan, see narrative following the 2016 Pension Benefits Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a qualified defined contribution 401(k) plan for all of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may defer up to 50% of their eligible pay to the plan up to Internal Revenue Code limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After employees have completed one full year of service, employee contributions are matched at 100% up to an overall limit of 4% and employees receive an additional Company contribution equal to 2% of earnings, subject to limits set by the Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are entitled to participate in our 401(k) plan on the same basis as our employees generally, except that, prior to the execution of his amended employment agreement in May 2016, Mr. Van Saun was not eligible to receive any Company contributions under our 401(k) plan due to his receipt of pension benefit funding under his previous employment agreement that was negotiated by RBS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs other than Mr. Fawcett are eligible to participate in Company-sponsored benefit programs, offered on the same terms and conditions as those made generally available to our employees, including medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our NEOs with independent advisors to assist them with financial planning, if desired by the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are also covered by a relocation policy and a charitable contribution policy that generally cover all our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our company car was used by certain of our NEOs for limited personal use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McCree is provided with a housing allowance through 2017 due to travel obligations associated with his role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Citizens has a Company-wide accountability review process to ensure that there is a standardized process to take appropriate action in instances where new information would have changed variable compensation decisions made in previous years or should be considered in making variable compensation decisions for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of that process, the Accountability Review Panel (ARP) meets on a regular basis to consider the events referred for its review by our businesses and control functions, to determine whether compensation adjustments are appropriate for involved colleagues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential actions by the ARP may include current-year variable compensation adjustment, forfeiture of unvested awards, or clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, RBS awards that were converted into Company share-based awards in connection with our offering are subject to clawback provisions contained in the relevant plan rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and CFO are also subject to clawback as mandated by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee monitors regulatory developments relating to clawback and will continue to evaluate our practices in order to ensure they drive appropriate behavior and discourage inappropriate risk taking, as well as comply with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership and Retention Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains stock ownership and retention guidelines in order to further align the long-term interests of our executives and non-employee directors with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines require that our executives and non-employee directors hold shares having an aggregate value equal to a multiple of executives annual base salary or non-employee directors annual cash retainer, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position    Multiple Chief Executive Officer    5x Annual Base Salary Other Executives    3x Annual Base Salary Non-Employee Directors    4x Annual Cash Board Retainer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares that count for purposes of ownership under the guidelines include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) shares or units for which receipt has been deferred (including shares held through our 401(k) plan, shares purchased under our tax-qualified employee share purchase program, unvested restricted stock units and shares or units held through a deferred compensation plan maintained by Citizens) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) restricted stock and unvested restricted stock units (that may only be settled in shares) hat are subject to time-based vesting conditions only.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unexercised options (whether vested or unvested), performance awards (including performance-based restricted stock and performance-based units) and unvested restricted stock units hat may only be settled in cash do not count towards the satisfaction of these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive or non-employee director has five years from the date he or she becomes subject to these guidelines to achieve compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of modifications made to our guidelines effective for 2016, executives are also required to hold 50% of shares acquired as a result of settlement of compensatory awards granted in 2016 and onward until ownership guidelines have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starting in 2016, directors restricted stock unit awards are not settled until their cessation from service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on Hedging and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit our employees, including our NEOs, from engaging in any hedging transactions (including transactions involving options, puts, calls, prepaid variable forward contracts, equity swaps, collars and exchange funds or other derivatives) that are designed to hedge or speculate on any change in the market value of the Companys equity securities or pledging their ownership in our securities (including equity-based awards), which would undermine the risk alignment embedded in our equity-based compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m), a public company generally may not deduct compensation in excess of $1 million paid to its chief executive officer and the three other most highly compensated executive officers (other than the chief financial officer), unless the compensation qualifies as performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that tax deductibility of compensation s an important factor, but not the sole or primary factor in setting executive compensation policy or in rewarding executive performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we seek to structure our variable equity-based and cash-based
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: incentive awards to be deductible under Section 162(m), if possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, to maintain flexibility in compensating our executives, we do not have a policy requiring compensation to be fully deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Process for Approval of Equity Grants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not grant equity awards in anticipation of the release of material, non-public information, nor do we time the release of material, non-public information based on equity grant dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has delegated the authority to make off-cycle equity grants under the Citizens Financial Group, Inc. 2014 Omnibus Plan (the Omnibus Plan) to participants other than our executives to the Equity Committee of the Board, which is comprised of our CEO, subject to imits designated by the Compensation Committee, as described above in Board Governance and Oversight Committees of the Board.

sentences.text: 2016 Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sponsor the CFG Pension Plan (formerly RBS Americas Pension Plan) (Pension Plan), which is a non-contributory defined benefit pension plan that is qualified under Section 401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan was closed to new hires and re-hires effective January 1, 2009, and frozen to all participants and benefit accruals effective December 31, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular full-time and part-time employees of the Company who were hired before January 1, 2009 and completed one year of service were eligible for benefits under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit under the Pension Plan for employees is currently calculated using a formula based on an employees average gross compensation (defined under the Pension Plan as a participants average eligible compensation during five years of employment (whether or not consecutive) prior to December 31, 2012 yielding the highest average), subject to limitations imposed by the Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible compensation generally includes all taxable compensation, other than certain equity-based and non-recurring amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formula generally provides for a benefit of 1% of average gross compensation multiplied by each year of the participants credited service, with
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: such benefit percentage varying depending on the employees hire date and retirement date, as specified under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension benefits under the Pension Plan are generally payable in the form of a monthly annuity, though benefits under the Pension Plan may be received as a lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants pension benefit under the Pension Plan vests in full on the normal retirement date, generally, when the participant reaches age 65 (or, for certain individuals (depending on the date such participant commenced participation in the Pension Plan), the fifth anniversary of the date such participant commenced participation in the Pension Plan, if later).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants pension benefit under the Pension Plan also vests in full upon completion of five years of vesting service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may begin receiving full retirement benefits on the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the normal retirement date and may be eligible for reduced benefits if retiring after attainment of age 55 with a minimum of five years of vesting service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who retire after attainment of age 62 with a minimum of twenty years of vesting service are eligible to receive unreduced retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Conner became a participant in the Pension Plan on July 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Conner was not eligible for early retirement under the Pension Plan and, based on his age at date of hire, will never be eligible for unreduced retirement benefits at age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sponsor two nonqualified deferred compensation plansthe CFG Deferred Compensation Plan and the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan (formerly known as the RBS Americas Deferred Compensation Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following closure of the CFG Deferred Compensation Plan to new participants on December 31, 2008, the RBS Americas Deferred Compensation Plan was adopted, effective as of January 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our deferred compensation plans currently do not offer any matching contributions or provide for above-market earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Mr. Van Saun was the only NEO who participated in the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan and elected to defer 20% of his base salary and 80% of the cash portion of his variable compensation award for the 2016 performance year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the CFG Voluntary Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, eligibility is limited to employees who have total compensation in the immediately preceding year equal to or exceeding the Internal Revenue Code Section 401(a)(17) limit for the relevant plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are permitted to defer between 1% and 80% of their base salary and annual bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants select the allocation of their accounts among investment indices available under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has the power to amend the plan at any time, as long as the amount accrued to the date of amendment in any account under the plan is not decreased or otherwise restricted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, following a termination of employment participants in the CFG Executive Voluntary Deferred Compensation Plan are entitled to receive amounts that have been deferred under that plan.
